page.title: 12SMITHS,BISHOP'S CLEEVE
page.content: {Smiths Industries}employs many people in Bishop's Cleeve.Samuel Smith,the firms founder and craftsman watchmaker opened a shop in London in 1851.In 1925 Henry Hughes and Son,marine instrument makers since the 18th cent.,joined the firm.In 1927 motorcar instruments were first made by the firm,and in 1933 they produced their first autopilot.In World War Two they built two factories south of Bishop's Cleeve.{Smiths}is now a multibusiness organisation specialising in aerospace instruments and defence system technology.{Smiths}has caused the population in Bishop's Cleeve to increase and because of this a housing estate was begun on its own land in 1941.Bishop's Cleeve used to be an agricultural community but now it is industrial. {Smiths} used to employ 4,000;this has decreased recently.
